quiz.question: Which famous rapper wrote “Starry Night,” a poem dedicated to Van Gogh and his work?
quiz.feedback:
According to his former teacher Donald Hicken: “Tupac had this thing about Van Gogh. He talked about him a lot, he really related to him as an artist.” In his poem, “Starry Night,” Tupac writes to Van Gogh:

you have given them the stars at night

and u have given them

Bountiful Bouquets of Sunflowers

but 4 u there is only contempt

quiz.question: Which of the following musicians composed a song in Van Gogh’s honor?
quiz.feedback: All of these artists have written their odes to the great Dutch artist. It was in fact his appreciation for Don McLean’s “Vincent” that inspired Tupac to pen his poem, “Starry Night.”

quiz.question: This film director produced a film on the life of Van Gogh. (He also once tattooed a U.S. president’s dog.):
quiz.feedback: Robert Altman directed the 1990 film Vincent and Theo. In the 1950s—before becoming one of the most celebrated filmmakers in America—Altman started a company called Identi-Code, an early attempt to help track lost pets. President Harry S. Truman invited Identi-Code to tattoo the presidential pooch as a way of promoting the service. Unfortunately, one of Altman’s partners left the country with the company’s entire earnings shortly thereafter, prompting Altman to move to California and pursue filmmaking.

quiz.question: What famous American movie director played Vincent van Gogh in Akira Kurasawa’s Dreams?
quiz.feedback: Legendary director Martin Scorsese takes an unlikely turn as Vincent van Gogh in a vignette from Japanese filmmaker Akira Kurasawa’s 1990 film Dreams. The movie received mixed reviews, but Washington Post critic Hal Hinson wrote: “Its only real vitality comes from Scorsese’s spiky energy and staccato line readings.”

quiz.question: This legendary sci-fi actor wrote and starred in a one-man teleplay called Vincent.
quiz.feedback: Best known for his role as Mr. Spock on Star Trek, Leonard Nimoy also pursued passions in photography, music, writing, and directing. He wrote and directed the teleplay Vincent in 1981, adapted from Phillip Stephens’s play Van Gogh.

quiz.question: In the Dr. Who episode “Vincent and the Doctor,” which of the following does NOT happen?

answers.text: Villagers attempt to stone Van Gogh and Dr. Who.
A space-travelling monster is impaled on Van Gogh’s easel.
Van Gogh is bitten by an Impressionist vampire.
Van Gogh is brought to the future to witness his enduring legacy.

quiz.feedback: Airing in 2010, the episode “Vincent and the Doctor” has since become a cult favorite among Dr. Who fans. Many strange things occur as the story unfolds; but Van Gogh being bitten by an Impressionist vampire is not one of them.

results.title: VAN GOGH QUIZ—Oof! You didn’t do so well.
results.description:
You might need to brush up on your Van Gogh knowledge. Check out Van Gogh’s Bedrooms at the Art Institute of Chicago to learn more about the artist and his enduring legacy.
